channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-7307] empty query string injects into number type will lead 404 error
item.description:
The http request:
GET /dubbott-demo-provider/v1.0/users/beanparam?a=&b= HTTP/1.1
HOST: localhost:8080
accept: application/json
content-type: application/json

The resource method returns null:
public String beanParam(@QueryParam("a") Integer a, @QueryParam("b") Integer b)

{ return a+b; }

javax.ws.rs.ClientErrorException: HTTP 404 Not Found

item.summary: empty query string injects into number type will lead 404 error

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The behavior in RI is:
Boxed number type with "" value will convert into null object, unboxed primitive type with "" value will convert into 0.

I will try to fix this bug, please assign to me as the owner. sergey_beryozkin

Thanks

404 is correct in general when the query parameter conversion fails (this is spec compliant).
What I'm not 100% sure is what to do with an empty value.

A null Integer indicates that no parameter has been provided at all, while in this case it has actually been provided, so 'null' will not represent that fact. Therefore if you need to support empty values then use String. Can you please check how Jersey reacts in this case ?

Thanks, Sergey
Neal, good, thanks for double-checking it already, OK, lets fix it, I agree
Neal, I do not see you alias in the list of Assignees, I wonder why, did you submit Apache ICLA ?
I see you in the ICLAs list

Yes, I am in ICLAs list and have permission to commit the code. Also the cxf committer list does not contain me, instead exit in people.apache.org.
http://people.apache.org/phonebook.html YES
http://cxf.apache.org/people.html NO
Thanks, Neal

Dear Sergey,

I have push code to git, why can not see the commit here?

Authenticate to see related commits

Please log in to approve this application: fisheye

Hi Neal, yes, saw your commit, thanks. I actually not sure how that works, I'm presuming you need to create an account there too, sometimes it does not allow me to check the commits, sometimes it does

Completed in all three branches. Please check and close the issue.
Thanks.
Thanks, can you please assign it you now ? I see a nealhu@gmail.com but it differs from your other email account so not 100% sure
Sorry, I cann't assign it to me. My jira id is nbqyqx@163.com, email is nealhu@apache.org. Would you please assign it above jira id? Thanks.
